item.description:
Attention... 

I've just checked the weather,To see if we'll be together.

Looks like no dangers, So go ahead and call the Rangers.

The hike is a "go", just so you know.

See you at Gate 35, A silver Corolla is what I'll drive.

Be sure to bring your permit and stuff, As I'd hate to send you home after telling you "tough".

 

Rangers: (413) 323-0192

You'll probably need permit number, where you are going (Gate 35), time (7pm-10pm).

 

At the risk of sounding like a meenie head, anybody who shows up without a permit will not be allowed to go with us. That is a Quabbin rule, not mine, but will be adhered to in order to keep in the good graces of the Quabbin rangers!!! (updated 7/24)


 

 

What to bring:

Your wallet card permit!!!

Your dashboard permit!!!

Bug spray.  This IS the Quabbin (ie, ticks).

Headlamp/flashlight.

Appropriate clothing for an evening hike.

Camera (who knows if there will be photo ops)

Drink / Snack. If it's still hot, bring plenty to drink.


Many of us have hiked/biked/walked all over the beautiful Quabbin Reservoir. But how many of us have enjoyed the solitude at night? Not me... So lets change that!

PERMIT NEEDED!!! SEE BELOW!!!


The Quabbin Reservoir is open to night access from April 14th to October 13th this year. From their information:

Night Access Permits are required for access in the Quabbin Reservation and are good only for the time
period April 14, 2012 to October 13, 2012. Each person entering the Reservation must have a valid permit.
The permit allows the holder PEDESTRIAN ACCESS ONLY through Gates 16, 31, 33, 35, 41, & 43 during
the period of one hour past sunset to one hour before sunrise. Prior to each use, the holder must notify the
Quabbin Watershed Rangers at 413-323-0192 regarding the time and point of access. A permit is not
transferable and may be revoked for failure to adhere to these requirements or DCR Rules & Regulations.
Instructions for use and rules/regulations information will be included with the issued permits.

I propose a night hike as close to full moon as possible for an illuminating walk along the shores of the Quabbin. Gate #35 is a very flat route which follows the shoreline for a couple miles. We may include a little side trip to the Beaver Pond at dusk to see if there is anything going on a dusk... This is less of a "destination" hike and more of a "wonder what this looks like in dusk/night" hike.  If all goes well, we may have other night access hikes at other locations in the Quabbin!

Who knows what lurks in the darkness!!!

Link to "Night Access Permit":

http://www.mass.gov/dcr/watersupply/watershed/documents/quabnightaccess.pdf

Anybody interested in going MUST print out a "Night Access Application" and mail (or deliver) to the provided address. Best of all, the permits are FREE! You can either provide a self-addressed stamped envelope for them to mail you your permit or it will be available 10 days after you get the application to them for pickup at the Visitors Center. As stated above, YOU MUST CALL THE RANGERS AT 413-323-0192 the day of the hike to let them know that you have a valid permit, where you are going, and at what time.  Plan on doing this prior to arriving at Gate #35 as I cannot guarantee cell phone access from there!

Time is tentatively set at 7:00pm, but could be moved forward or back if needed.

group.name: Northern Central MA, Southern NH Hiking Group

item.name: Who is afraid of the dark? A night hike in the Quabbin!
